name: Alexander, Keith USA (Ret.)
title: Board Director (Amazon); Chairman (IronNet, resigned Feb 2024)
notes: Retired four-star U.S. Army General who served as the 16th Director of the NSA and first Commander of U.S. Cyber Command (2010-2014). Founded IronNet Cybersecurity in 2014 and joined Amazon's board of directors in September 2020.
ngos: National Security Institute (George Mason University) advisory board; SolCyber board of directors

name: Anderson, David L.
title: Partner
notes: Former U.S. Attorney for the Northern District of California (2019-2021), nominated by President Trump. Stanford Law graduate who clerked for Justice Anthony Kennedy. Returned to Sidley Austin's white collar practice in September 2021.
political_donations: Appointed by Republican President Trump; previously served under both Republican and Democratic administrations

name: Baggott, Kenneth B.
title: Owner/Principal
notes: San Francisco advertising executive and prolific Bohemian Club playwright. Authored multiple Grove Plays including 'Marius of the Populares' (2001), 'Atlantis' (2010), 'Rama' (2014), and 'Grendl' (2019).

name: Berg, Shelton
employer: University of Miami Frost School of Music
title: Dean and Patricia L. Frost Professor of Music (stepping down Spring 2026)
notes: Renowned jazz pianist, six-time Grammy-nominated arranger and producer. Served as Dean of the Frost School of Music since 2007 after previously holding the McCoy/Sample Endowed Chair at USC Thornton School of Music.

name: Bugg, J. Bruce Jr.
employer: Texas Partners Bank / Southwest Bancshares, Inc.
title: Chairman, President, and CEO (deceased August 6, 2025)
notes: San Antonio banker and tax lawyer who chaired the Texas Transportation Commission (appointed by Gov. Greg Abbott in 2015). Died August 6, 2025 at age 70. Also served as Chairman and Trustee of the Tobin Endowment, credited with helping build the Tobin Center for the Performing Arts.
political_donations: Republican; donated approximately $299,845 to Governor Greg Abbott; member of Abbott's Strike Force to Open Texas

name: Bush, John
title: Executive Vice President
notes: Seasoned commercial real estate professional based in San Francisco with decades of experience in development, investment, and consulting. Previously co-founded two outdoor sports brands, an M&A advisory firm, and a management consulting practice. Has raised over $60 million in investment equity and acquired over $400 million in portfolio assets.

name: Cobb, Charles E. Jr.
title: CEO and Senior Managing Director
notes: Businessman and diplomat who served as U.S. Ambassador to Iceland under President George H.W. Bush and as Under Secretary and Assistant Secretary at the U.S. Department of Commerce under President Reagan. Previously served as Chairman/CEO of Arvida Corporation and Disney Development Company and sat on boards of nine publicly traded corporations.
ngos: Council of American Ambassadors; Woodrow Wilson International Center for Scholars; Eisenhower Fellowships; University of Miami; Florida State Board of Administration; American Academy of Diplomacy; Council on Foreign Relations; Urban Land Institute; Cobb Family Foundation (co-founder)
political_donations: Republican; served in Reagan and George H.W. Bush administrations; publicly stated 'My altruism generally follows Republican candidates'

name: Cohn, Robert
title: Board Director / CEO Advisor
notes: Silicon Valley luminary who founded Octel Communications in 1982, which commercialized voice mail and was acquired by Lucent Technologies in 1997 for over $2 billion. Previously a partner at Sequoia Capital (2002-2004) and board member at Trimble Navigation, Electronic Arts, Charter Communications, and King Digital Entertainment.

name: Dixon, Donald R.
title: Co-Founder and Managing Director
notes: Technology investor with over 30 years of experience, specializing in cybersecurity. Co-founded Trident Capital in 1993 and ForgePoint Capital in 2015. Previously a Co-President at Partech International, Managing Director at Alex. Brown & Sons, and Vice President at Morgan Stanley. Served on IronNet board (Class III director from Sept 2022) and as Amprius Technologies Board Chairman since December 2016.
ngos: Business Executives for National Security (BENS) director; Aspen Institute Cybersecurity Group; Princeton School of Engineering Advisory Board; Harvard Kennedy School Center for Public Leadership Advisory Board; Naval Postgraduate School Board of Advisors

name: Field, Gregg
title: Record Producer and Musician; Chairman, USC Thornton School of Music Board of Councilors
notes: Seven-time Grammy winner and Latin Grammy 'Producer of the Year.' Former drummer for Frank Sinatra, Count Basie, Ella Fitzgerald, and Ray Charles. Served as Recording Academy Governor and Grammy Trustee. Chairman of the Board of Councilors at USC Thornton School of Music.
ngos: USC Thornton School of Music Board of Councilors (Chairman); Library of Congress Gershwin Prize Advisory Board; Frost School of Music (University of Miami) Board of Advisors

name: Fisher, Robert J.
title: Director and Chairman of the Board
notes: Son of Gap Inc. co-founders Donald and Doris Fisher. Has been a Gap director since 1990 and served as Chairman (2004-2007 and current). Previously held roles as Gap's CFO, COO, and served as interim CEO (2019-2020). Board member at Gap for over 30 years.
ngos: San Francisco Museum of Modern Art (board chair); Conservation International (board member, executive committee); Natural Resources Defense Council (honorary board of trustees)
political_donations: Mixed; donated $1 million to anti-Obama dark money group in 2012; Fisher family collectively gave $10 million to same group. Also has supported Democratic candidates and environmental causes.

name: Holt, Benjamin D. III
notes: Member of the prominent Holt family of Stockton, California, descendants of Benjamin Holt (1849-1920), inventor of the Caterpillar tractor and founder of Holt Manufacturing Company. Specific biographical and employer details not found in public records.

name: Holt, Nicholas V
notes: Member of the prominent Holt family of Stockton/San Francisco, California, descendants of Benjamin Holt. His father Nicholas Holt IV (1935-2015) was a San Francisco stockbroker who founded Nicholas Holt Securities on Pine Street and held a seat on the Pacific Coast Stock Exchange. Specific current employer details not found in public records.

name: Kiernan, Thomas F. III
title: Vice President
notes: Executive at O'Brien Kiernan Investment Co. (OBK), a San Francisco-based family-owned real estate firm established in 1923 that owns, develops and manages commercial properties throughout the United States. Listed as company Secretary in California business records. The firm is headquartered at 220 Montgomery Street, Suite 1050, San Francisco.

name: Knudsen, Colin R.
title: Senior Advisor
notes: Investment banker with 30+ years of experience specializing in Technology, Media and Telecom (TMT) M&A. Previously co-founded Coady Diemar Partners and served as Managing Director at BTIG and Credit Suisse, where he co-headed the Data Services Group. Also a Partner and Co-Owner of Knudsen Vineyards in Oregon's Willamette Valley.

name: Knudsen, David C.
title: Partner
notes: One of four siblings who inherited Knudsen Vineyards in Oregon's Dundee Hills from their father, pioneer Oregon vintner Cal Knudsen. Serves as Partner at the family winery along with brothers Colin R. Knudsen, Cal Knudsen Jr., and sister Page Knudsen Cowles. The vineyard was established in 1971.

name: Link, Christopher
notes: A Christopher Link is listed as an attorney on LinkedIn associated with Cahill Gordon & Reindel LLP. Specific biographical details matching this Bohemian Club Owl's Nest member could not be confirmed in public records.

name: MacGuire, Michael C.
notes: Specific biographical and employer information for Michael C. MacGuire as an Owl's Nest camp member could not be confirmed in public records. Multiple individuals with similar names were found in California business contexts but could not be matched to this specific individual.

name: McCann, Edward Francis II
title: Senior Vice President of Investment Banking (former)
notes: American investment banker with Naval Academy background (B.S. 1965, M.S. Electrical Engineering). Career included roles as division manager at Chevron Shipping Company and Standard Oil Corporation California in San Francisco, and senior vice president of investment banking at Robert Fleming Inc. Member of the Council on Foreign Relations and Navy League.
ngos: Council on Foreign Relations; Society of Naval Architects and Marine Engineers; Navy League; Naval Academy Alumni Association

name: McGinn, Michael E.
title: Partner and Co-Head of Sixth Street Growth
notes: Partner at Sixth Street, a global investment firm headquartered in San Francisco, where he co-heads the Growth equity team. Previously a Managing Director at Goldman Sachs in their Americas Special Situations Group (AmSSG) from 2004-2018. Received a B.B.A. magna cum laude from the University of Notre Dame in 2002.

name: McKernan, Michael K.
notes: Specific biographical details for Michael K. McKernan as an Owl's Nest member could not be confirmed in public records. Multiple individuals with similar names were found in California but could not be matched to this specific individual.

name: Miller, Knute Michael
title: Lobbyist and Attorney
notes: California-licensed attorney (State Bar #51154) and registered federal lobbyist. Listed in OpenSecrets revolving door database. Active in Bay Area Camino (pilgrimage) community as Northern California Chapter coordinator for American Pilgrims on the Camino.
ngos: American Pilgrims on the Camino (chapter coordinator)

name: Nauman, John Edward II
notes: Specific biographical details for John Edward Nauman II as an Owl's Nest member could not be confirmed in public records. The name is uncommon and searches returned no clearly matching individuals.

name: Nauman, Peter B.
notes: Specific biographical details for Peter B. Nauman as an Owl's Nest member could not be confirmed in public records. Searches returned multiple individuals with similar names but none could be clearly matched to this specific member.

name: Parfit, Matthew
title: Owner
notes: Software designer and production professional based in San Rafael, California with 30 years of experience. Owner of Ground Control, a software and technology services company. UC Berkeley graduate with clients ranging from school districts to vineyards and golf courses.

name: Porter, Mark Edward
title: Partner
notes: San Francisco-based attorney at Fenwick & West LLP specializing in mergers and acquisitions and commercial/bankruptcy matters. Has represented acquirers and sellers in over 80 completed transactions exceeding $5 billion in aggregate value. Former Chair of the Executive Committee of the Business Law Section of the California State Bar.

name: Smith, Jeffrey C.
notes: Specific biographical details for Jeffrey C. Smith as an Owl's Nest member could not be confirmed in public records. Multiple individuals with this common name were found but none could be clearly matched to this specific member.

name: Sperring, Randall J.
title: CEO
notes: CEO of O'Brien Kiernan Investment Co., a San Francisco-based family-owned commercial real estate firm established in 1923 with over $1 billion in assets under management. Previously an attorney at Lillick & Charles LLP and Crosby, Heafey, Roach & May LLP. J.D. from University of San Francisco School of Law.

name: Stephens, W. Clayton Jr.
notes: Son of Warren Clayton Stephens Sr. (1942-2014), founder of Warren Capital Corp. in Novato, California. His father was a widely respected North Bay financier and philanthropist. W. Clayton Stephens Jr. is listed in Kentfield, Marin County, California. Was named as a plaintiff in litigation related to Warren Capital following his father's death.
